instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message:
hello, tried this unit with 3 ssd with 3 different MacOS versions same problem.
is this ram issue? please give some advice how to next. motherboard is clean no visible corroded parts

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message:
The error message is directly RAM related.
There are only 4 chips, easy to change them.

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message:
is this required to change or can just try reball? 
because i dont have ram for the moment.

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message:
You can try reballing.
But don't expect miracles...

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message: I have the same board rebooting when I run geekbench 5 to stress it. Are there diagnostics available for download For this board?

threads.title: a1502 820-4924 panic
threads.message:
ASD not available since 2015.
An official Apple service can run online diagnostic.

You can start embedded basic diagnostic mode (built in AHT); will not get too much information probably.
